function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Ineffective occupant behavior customization leading to increased virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagion-related behaviours like breathing, sneezing, and coughing can lead to the spread of air-based contagions in the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface-based contagions from behaviors like surface-touching and hand-sanitizing may lead to the spread of contagious diseases through contact with contaminated surfaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Simulating virus-human-building interactions can lead to a better understanding of how contagious diseases spread in built environments, but may also present privacy and ethical concerns related to data collection and monitoring.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dynamic human-building interactions facilitate virus transmission and contagion-related behaviors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virtual humans with agency behaving realistically within the building model can simulate virus transmission scenarios.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Modeling contagion-related human behaviors within the building can provide insights into virus spread dynamics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for micro-level behaviors such as breathing and touching in covid-19 transmission scenarios","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited flexibility for customizing configurations within the simulation tool","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focus on small spaces with simple geometry in existing virus transmission simulations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete integration of agency into virtual humans to incorporate dynamics of human behaviour within the building.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglecting to incorporate contextual information in the building model for human behaviour simulation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relying solely on macro-level mobility aspects in the simulation without considering micro-level interactions within environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overlooking connectivity between spaces due to building design can contribute to air-based and surface-based transfer of pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for individual and social behaviors in epidemic models and design decisions may lead to ineffective control measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the influence of behavior on the spread of covid-19 may hinder control efforts and re-opening strategies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission within physical spaces via air-based diffusion and circulation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus transmission via touching interactions with surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Simulation of specific scenarios within confined spaces to evaluate transmission risk","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupant behavior leading to virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex human behaviors with temporal dynamics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitation in understanding holistic overview of data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation through human-building interactions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited focus on long-term effects of human-building interactions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Stochastic modelling paradigms for simulating occupant behavior","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The focus on virus transmission and its impact on architectural design and facility planning","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Simulating the locations or moving trajectories of people in architectural-scale designs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorporating agency into virtual humans to evaluate design with multi-occupant scenarios","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for virus transmission in early design evaluation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate analysis of space occupancy and human behavior","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on already constructed and occupied environments for research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential risk of virus transmission within the context of covid-19 due to the design of the occupancy simulation system.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited exploration of how to apply technology in an interactive tool to support facility planning and analysis procedures in the hci community.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential lack of consideration for other human factors in space analysis tools, such as spatial ergonomics, productivity, and social and physical comfort.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dynamic human-building interactions influencing virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Customization of space configurations and occupant behaviors for occupancy simulation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding routes of virus transmission in specific conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission due to the large number of passersby throughout the day in a particular area.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential asynchronous transmission of the virus by a single individual contaminating a shared environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of ability to analyze decisions within the context of relevant human-building interactions and their relationships to potential virus spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission via surfaces and air circulation within the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for social and physical interactions among occupants and the built environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Existing systems that only follow simple measures such as physical distancing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased number of tweets about neighbour noise due to lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decrease in perceived outdoor noise level and increase in perceived neighbour noise level during the lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Respondents more annoyed by neighbour noise than outdoor noise during the lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data collection from a specific location, period, and language may not represent a comprehensive picture of noise complaints and sources.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Manual identification of noise sources from social media data limits the scalability and accuracy of the analysis.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of objective data on noise measurement and sound insulation of buildings hinders accurate assessment of indoor noise sources.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decrease in outdoor noise levels due to travel restrictions during lockdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
